abstract.p: Sondra R Markman letter on Jeffrey Gettleman's March 18 travel article on visit to Nairobi, Kenya

block.p: To the Editor: ''36 Hours; Nairobi, Kenya'' by Jeffrey Gettleman (March 18) brought back pleasant memories of the Giraffe Center and the Karen Blixen Museum. I would like to call attention to one must-see opportunity that is identified on the map that accompanied the article, but was not mentioned by Mr. Gettleman. Nairobi National Park, Kenya's oldest national park, was established in 1946. Nairobi is the only major city in the world that neighbors a major game protection park. It is eerie when we review our photos that show this park with wildlife in a natural setting and the city skyline in the distance. We also saw incredible birds. It is well worth spending a few of those 36 hours here.
